intro: Trichinium pallidum, commonly known as the pale trichinium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Trichinium pallidum is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitats.
